title: Small caps for office?
content:
I've created a new version of a typeface for the correct use for "Office" users, but the small caps won't work... do small caps need an special Unicode to work in office? I've seen that there is a Unicode something like 1D00 (for A).

My typeface had 14 weights... and I've reduced it to 4, and-re named it using TransType 4

Any help that I can get in this matter will be welcomed.  
Thanks!
author: ferfolio_2

comments.content: You could implement them as a stylistic set. Those do work in Microsoft Office.
Or as separate fonts. Many fonts intended for office users name them as [Font name] SC [style name]. Alegreya, for example.
